description: Come experience an unparalleled escape room adventure with Omescape Canada. With immersive puzzles that correlate to our themes and set designs that make you forget you’re just in a game room,our escape rooms are groundbreaking in technology and are amongst the highest rated escape rooms. With mechanics which are sure to impress, Omescape will offer memories of jaw dropping moments and astound even the most experienced escape enthusiast. Come experience today!

reviews.title: Birthday party
text: Hosted a birthday party for 8 fourteen year olds last night. Easy breezy. They're like a well oiled machine. Everything was on time...the table space, the room, the pizza. Made my life much easier. The kids loved it. Would highly recommend.

reviews.title: A birthday party to be remembered !
text: My son had his birthday party with his friends and he had a great time ! Amazing experience: the escape room was so much fun and the Omescape team did a great job in organizing the entire event for us ! Thank you !!!

reviews.title: Would Recommend
text: One of my favourite escape rooms in the GTA, I have done nearly every room here except Motel Betty and Hong Kong After Dark. Customer service could be improved, but I have never had any major issues with them. Room design is always extremely immersive and filled with interesting puzzles to solve. You can tell they have a big budget when designing these rooms.

reviews.title: The penitentiary rocks
text: We went as a group of 7.  The escape room was very challenging and it took all of our effort to escape with 58 seconds left on the clock.  It was a very high quality escape room.  The staff did a great job organizing us and overall it was a great time.

reviews.title: Family escape
text: Good escape room with interesting and challenging puzzles.... Will definatly  return and try a different room. The staff very friendly, helpful and fun

reviews.title: Puzzling
text: This was a great team building experience.   Everyone in our group enjoyed it and had fun.   The puzzles were not as easy as other escape rooms, but they were fun and innovative.  Totally recommend Omescape as a team building facility.

reviews.title: lots of fun
text: A pretty decent escape room.
Also a board game cafe.
With lots of games available to play.
Coffee wasn't great

reviews.title: entertaining, yet disappointing
text: first of all, I would like to point out that I have completed 50+ escape games and am a game master at another escape room. I LOVE escape rooms and have left plenty of raving reviews for amazing escape rooms and Omescape was recommended by customers where I work. I read some reviews about the great rooms but some issues with rude or careless staff - hoped it was a few off experiences or grumpy guests and went in with an open mind expecting nothing but a great time :)

Came with family (who also have done many escape rooms) for Mothers Day and did "Kingdom of Cats". Staff were not aware I was someone working at highly rated escape room, so it was an average experience, nothing special, but I mean they barely interacted with us to begin with, see below. It was very interesting, unique layout and fun puzzles, not surprisingly we finished with 30 mins remaining and used 1 hint. I enjoyed the room as a whole, it was fun enough.

Where this became disappointing was the staff and the general flow and atmosphere of the experience. It felt like bare minimum was done for us. we were shown a video in the middle of the lobby, nothing was explained (locks we will see and if linear/non linear) both pretty standard things to know across the industry, but hey maybe they just don't do that - but of the 50+ companies I've experienced, that was a first for neither to be explained. If it was my first escape room, I would be confused, wouldn't be impressed, and it would make me not want to try another one, anywhere, if I got this minimal amount of explanation or care from the staff.

When we completed the room, the final puzzle and opened the final door, we were met by... no one, a dark hallway. Escape rooms are exciting, completing the final puzzle should be exciting - 95% of the time of completing a room, you are met at least by an applauding staff member, a message of congratulations over walkie/screen, or a combination of the two. To open a door into a dark hallway where we were met by no one, no message, nothing, knocked it from "yes we did it!" to "okay... now what, are we done??" we felt abandoned by the staff. We ended not where we started, so we weren't familiar with what to do. We walked up to the front desk, found 3 staff sitting there, ON THEIR CELL PHONES, and watching screens. I spoke up and said "mhmm, sorry how much time did we finish with?" to get their attention to us, where they kinda looked around lost and one guy said "exactly 30 minutes", again, very monotone, no excitment, just the amount of effort minimum. This was also during the raptors playoff game, so we think they may have been focused on that instead of their job. I can't tell them how to run their business or how to have personality, but I would hope for the money I spent, I would get at least a decent experience and shown respect and care from the staff.

We went to their photo stage, took a picture, and were told to have a good night. that's it. bare minimum conversation, no personable touch by any staff, nothing. The difference between a good experience and a great or exceptional one is 100% the staff and how engaging and personable they are. period.

It's unfortunate because the staff of where I work frequently take "field trips" all together to have a fun day off trying other escape rooms together, and this was high on our list, and now I think it will be removed.

The room was fun and unique for sure, but I can't get past how much the atmosphere and staff effect the experience, and with my experience on both guest and game master side, it was the lowest I've seen. Hopefully sometime in the future we can give it a second chance or try the other location.

reviews.title: So fun and innovative!
text: We visited Omescape last night and did the Project Sphere room. The puzzles were challenging but fun and we were so impressed with the quality of the game. We can’t wait to visit again and try another room!

reviews.title: Eskaping Eskellently in Markham
text: We've done Project Sphere, Kingdom of Cats & Dark Altar at the Omescape Markham location. Each experience was engaging and fun. The puzzles are pretty unique and the game creators put in the effort and detail into those rooms. We'd like to come back to do the other rooms one day.

reviews.title: Outstanding room design and puzzles
text: I learned about Omescape on EscRoomAddict.com and decided to give their Kingdom of Cats and Joker's Asylum rooms a try. Their rating systems are really accurate, take heed.
Kingdom of Cats is incredible fun and creative. Good for beginners and experienced people alike. SO fun.
Joker's Asylum is the hardest escape room I have ever played. We only had 5 people (7 recommended - and I agree with this recommendation). We got just destroyed.
I really recommend this company's rooms.

reviews.title: Project Sphere (Mysterious Study) Challenging but logical room(s)
text: Great fun, enough of a challenge to want to explore some of their other rooms (which we did).  The decor/layout of the rooms are what make these escape rooms fun and give credibility to the challenge.

reviews.title: Completed almost all the rooms
text: Joker's Asylum is definitely my favourite room escape to date but one of the hardest ones at Omescape. All the rooms are challenging and a great way to test your brain and the teamwork with friends. Highly recommend anyone who is interested in going for any of the rooms.

reviews.title: Super exhausting fun
text: Awesome time with 10 friends! The host was very friendly and helpful. Definitely come with a big group and be prepared to run!

reviews.title: Awesome running man fame
text: Great maze with a variety of interesting games. They also offer other creative escape games. The staffs are friendly too. Recommended for any party size!

reviews.title: Running man game
text: This is a good game of running man which is fun and engaging. There's a good mix of physical activity and strategy. Recommend!

reviews.title: Epic Runner
text: Played Epic Runner and had a great time.  Run around trying to tag a feudal lord while the Lord and retainers fend off the outlaws.  Also had a few games of running from the enevitable zombie apocalypse.  Great little maze and a ton of fun.

reviews.title: Epic runner Scarborough
text: Had a fantastic time, the place is well setup for the games. The time just flew by, we went with a group of 11 people

reviews.title: Fun time
text: We did epic runner. This was a fun time. If you want to play board games where you are the pawns, this is where to come!

reviews.title: Epic Runner
text: Was great, good with friends: team bonding. Lots of different type of games, and overall great experience.

reviews.title: The best escape room!
text: I took four girls aged 11 for a birthday party.  We did the Cats Kingdom.  The rooms were absolutely amazing and the puzzles were very clever.  We did not escape but did make it to the last room.  The girls had an amazing time and I know I will go back with my own group of friends (adults over 40 :) ).  The best escape room I have ever been to.  High quality and amazing design!  There is a room there to play board games as well and we had the bubble tea and frozen yoghurt which were both delicious.

reviews.title: My Son’s 14th Birthday
text: We recently visited Omescape in Markham, with 6 fourteen yr old boys. Everyone had a great time. We had been to an escape room in the past but Omescape is the next level of fun!!!!!!! I would definitely recommend. In planning the party I had several questions and the manager was quick to answer by email all of my questions and was very accommodating. Great place for a corporate bonding session or just to get together with friends.

reviews.title: Great experience with group of friends
text: Omescape has a fun atmosphere and we had a really great time in our escape room.  There were 7 of us together who did the "Dark Alter" (4/5 star difficulty) escape room.  We've all done escape rooms before, and felt that this one was well set up, a fair difficulty level and did not feel too crowded for 7 of us.  The puzzles were tricky, but not illogically so, and there were definitely a number of "cool!" elements!  Overall, we had a lot of fun and would definitely go back to try other rooms!  My friends have done "The Kingdom of Cats" and also said they enjoyed it.
Had we more time, the board games and bubble tea (extra $$) area would have been fun to hang out in before or afterwards.
**Would definitely recommend booking a time slot ahead of time on their website as the time slot we wanted to first book was already taken!

reviews.title: Fun but with room for growth/improvement
text: First time playing escape room; emotion is a mix since wanted to escape in decent time record and how brainiac we are to solve these clues.  Clearly get there at least 20mins beforehand so you can complete form and check in using different social media outlets to get $3/person (each person has to do it in order to get $3 off).

The setup is nice; there is a bubble tea place with snacks, a big board game area and tables/chairs to enjoy the board games.  The escape rooms are off to the right of the check in desk.  There is an instructional video prior to being led into the room.  You get blinds as they lead you to the game room.  You also get a walkie talkie to ask for unlimited hints from the staff.

The overall experience wasn't too bad; we all had fun.  We have 2 suggestions: A. to put actual instructions in the room to help understand what has to be solved.  Once you take off your blinds after listening to the story line; we're left to scramble and make sense of what is in the room to proceed.  Despite the walkie talkie; we didn't find it too helpful because at times, it get very static which makes it difficult to hear what the hint is given to us.  Even the staff has a difficult time to hear the questions we asked.  Because of that, we find time ticking away.  B. Perhaps improve the lighting a little since it is quite dim and sort of makes the task difficult (yes, we're aware it is supposed to be as realistic as possible).

reviews.title: Top Escape Game in Toronto!
text: My friends all agree it's the best Saturday afternoon we've ever had of the year! We had sooo much fun at Omescape.

We played Dark Altar, Joker's Asylum and Project Sphere and enjoyed all 3 games. High production value, good set design, a good commination of challenging puzzles and fun puzzles. Require a lot of teamwork and creative thinking, not scary :)

I played more than 30 escape games and some of my friends only played a few. Omescape is great for everyone in our group.  I came from USA and it really surprises me that you can play such a high-quality escape game with this price.  Between games, we played their board games and enjoyed milk tea. What else can you ask for a group of gamers :)

reviews.title: The Kingdom of Cats / Project Sphere
text: We were heading down to the GTA area for a wedding and decided to tackle some escape rooms while down there.  Two of the rooms offered by Omescape intrigued us.  (The other three were not our cup of tea - I do not enjoy dark/dim rooms, or rooms where you are handcuffed.  However, the increased difficulty level intrigued us.)  We liked the fact that they rated their rooms for difficulty.  Our team of three (2 adults and 1 child) tackled "The Kingdom of Cats" and "Project Sphere" after a ~4 hour drive down to Markham after work.  (see below for comments regarding the rooms we played)

We were greeted promptly when we arrived, and checked in efficiently.  The facility is spacious, and has a large check-in area.  Bubble tea/snack bar & eating/board game playing area takes up the rest of the space.  The staff is friendly.
1.   The Kingdom of Cats  4.5 stars

The room was a comfortable size with good lighting. The room & decor were of high quality.  There was some climbing involved in one section, but I think young kids would be able to climb it safely with some parental supervision.  One area had lower ceilings, but it did not feel claustrophobic.  There was a good variety and quantity of puzzles, some quite unique.  The was a good balance between mechanical, mathematical, logical and observational puzzles.  They were mostly intuitive.  Overall this room was quite enjoyable.  Only one puzzle felt like a chore, but after calling for a hint, the gamemaster suggested a different way of solving it, which helped a bit (along with a bit of trial and error for the one part that suggestion didn't work for).  This is definitely a family-friendly escape room, and could be done with kids as young as 9 or 10.  I think it would be a good room for first-time escapers.   My daughter loved all the cat stuffies!   The long skinny one was her favourite!  (Gamemaster:  where can we find/buy one of those?)  We completed this room with about 15 minutes to spare.  After having done about 35 escape rooms in three different cities, this room would rank in our top five favourites!  It is one of the most creative rooms we've seen to date.
2.  Project Sphere (Mysterious Study)  4 stars

The room was a comfortable size; only one section was a bit tighter, but not claustrophobic.  The lighting was good overall, but there was a small section with slightly dimmer lighting.  The room & decor were of medium-high quality.  Crawling was required by one or two members of the team, and it was amusing watching them army-crawl past the obstacle.  Again there was a good variety and quantity of puzzles, though some of them were less intuitive.  It was a enjoyable room, though we disliked having to run/crawl back and forth to solve one of the puzzles.  This room would be suitable for families with kids that are a bit older (about 12/13 or older).  I would consider this a more challenging room.  We completed the room seconds before the time limit.  Overall, this room would rank in the middle tier of the rooms we've done.  (The theme/back story is a common one among escape rooms... I actually got it mixed up with another escape room and was confused as to how the decor was supposed to tie into the story... oops!!!  made a lot more sense when I finally figured it out :o) )

reviews.title: Lots of fun
text: Finding the place was harder than I expected. You have to go around the building. Once my goup got there, the staff was friendly and quick to get us started. Once our mission had started, our walkie talkie didn't work but the staff did what they could. Ultimately, we got to the last room but ran out of time. There were 4 of us (3 adults and 1 teen) working on Project Sphere.
On the whole, the escape room was fun and the clues were clever.

reviews.title: Best Escape Room Ive Tried
text: I've tried almost all of their escape rooms and they do not disappoint! I find myself wanting to come back to this place and recommending it my friends. Its quite the drive from Mississauga, but I feel like its worth it comparing it other escape rooms locally. The rooms are outstanding and innovative. Nothing like I've seen before. Can't wait to visit their new location and try their rooms there

reviews.title: Great Space! Need more staff!
text: We were a group of 8 that played EpicRunner and I felt that the set up of the arena was fairly large and interesting with several obstacles. The games were simple to understand and was nicely introduced by the staff member. With the check-in, we were able to get a 3 dollar discount per person which was great as well, making it 23 dollars per person but here comes the downside. We had lots of trouble finding staff members to process our payment so we could get the game started. We booked for 1:30 and arrived at 1:15 pm but we weren't really invited into the arena for briefing until 1:45. In the end, we were only able to play 3 games and the staff member said we could not play another game because it's already 2:30 despite the delay start.
Anyhow, the challenges were fun and it's a recommended activity for a large group of friends to get a bit physical!

reviews.title: Amazing place run by amazing people
text: I took my 14 year old son to Omescape in Markham with his best friend and his best friend's mom. The place was inviting and clean. The room that we did was great! We all had so much fun and couldn't wait to come back again. The boys played on a vintage video game while me and my friend  sipped on yummy smoothies and chatted. Then they wanted to stay and play some board games. We loved the idea of having none electronic games to play and are looking to make Omescape a hang out place for our boys. The staff were so courteous and understanding of our unique situation. Their kindness and understanding touched us immensely. Thank you again so much and see you soon!!!

reviews.title: Great time!
text: We had a great time here. We did the Kingdom of Cats. Although we didn’t compete the task, we got pretty close. We will definitely come here again to dontheotje rooms.

reviews.title: Friendly staff, creative puzzles, excellent quality rooms
text: We did the Project Sphere in a large group and really enjoyed it.  The puzzles are creative and well thought out.  Puzzles matched the theme and made sense.  The difficulty was on par for our group.  The quality of the room was excellent!  Nothing cheezy.  It was definitely an enjoyable experience and we will be back to try other rooms.

reviews.title: Great staff, incredible rooms!
text: I have been here on two separate occasions, once with a large group of friends (7) and once with a group of four. Both times the people at the front desk were always kind and accommodating and they give out as many hints as you want/need. With the larger group of friends we attempted The Penitentiary which we could not complete and we found to be quite challenging even though it has a 4/5 rating. Mostly because we were kind of running around aimlessly. I will say this room has a lot of ropes and you are separated into two groups at the beginning of this room. With the smaller group of four we actually did the Joker's Asylum where the minimum number of players is five but they let us play if we just paid for the extra missing person. This game was 5/5 but we managed to complete it with one less person even though the difficulty was much harder. This game also separates the group at the beginning and if you're easily spooked this game might not be for you as the sounds played throughout the game were a little bit creepy. Both games consisted of moving throughout 2+ rooms and for the price, the experience is quite frankly unbeatable. The rooms are unique and I left both times with a great experience with my friends!

reviews.title: Excellent escape rooms!
text: We have done both Kingdom of Cats and Project Sphere. Project Sphere is definitely harder even though they are rated the same difficulty level. The variety and style of puzzles are challenging but very fun. They do a great job with the setup of the rooms too. We will definitely be back, and look forward to trying their other location in Scarborough.

reviews.title: Friendly staff, elaborate rooms
text: I have been to Omescape three times now, once for a corporate event, and all three visits were very enjoyable.  Staff is very helpful and friendly, and the rooms are full of interesting and elaborate puzzles. Difficult to escape, but they do offer unlimited clues!  Its a cool experience for any age group -  I would definitely come back again.

reviews.title: Great but difficult escape rooms.
text: Our escape group of 4 is intermediate level, having done about 7-8 rooms together. The Omescape rooms are several steps ahead of anything we've done in aesthetic, design, concept and tech. They are beautiful and detailed multi-room designs with many exciting surprises. They are also F#@^ing hard! We have done two 3/5 difficulty rooms and run out of time on the final few puzzles. This last time I asked what the success rate was on the room we had just failed.. he said 15%. So 15 out of 100 groups escape, and that is 3/5!? You have been warned! If escaping if important to you, work your way up to 3/5.

reviews.title: Omescape
text: Fun game but really tired. Try to bring up more people to come. The game Bang was really exciting. Should wear long sleeve shirt and don’t play too violently

reviews.title: Birthday Party
text: Hosts were great! Games were all super challenging but also so fun! Would highly recommend! Thumbs up!

reviews.title: Amazing!
text: My whole group absolutely loved the Kingdom of Cats! It was so cute and the puzzles were really impressive - challenging but not at all frustrating, which was great. The things we kept discovering as we made our way through the spaces had us cheering the whole time. SO much fun! Would highly recommend and I look forward to doing their other rooms!
Also, the blindfolds at the beginning of the game were a great touch - what a fun experience. Thank for your attention to detail Omescape!

reviews.title: A step above!
text: We've been to a few escape rooms in Markham and Omescape is our favourite so far. What really impressed my kids was what they called the "special features" like mechanized objects such as trap doors and moving walls. They also liked that the room they tried had "verticality" in the forms of stairs and crawl spaces. The staff was great, too.
